pull.title: Add "Copy address" item to the context menu in the Peers table
pull.body: It seems a useful feature. Related to #262.

labels.name: UX
labels.description: All about "how to get things done"

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body:
Thanks, I applied only the last commit 03a2b7426446693505af66280fd6868c210bd035 to the master branch, built it on Debian 10 Buster, and copying of the node address incl. port works. One can afterwards paste it from the clipboard.
I do not understand the code, just applied and tested it.
Screenshot:

![bildschirmfoto](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8447873/113037936-324d9800-9196-11eb-8431-d4e4b2cc86fa.png)

Concept ACK

since we are adding the ability to copy the address, is there any reason to still allow this to show up/be clicked on:

![Screen Shot 2021-04-05 at 1 21 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/113603496-06a53480-9612-11eb-9b72-0362b4c82b02.png)

> since we are adding the ability to copy the address, is there any reason to still allow this to show up/be clicked on:

Why not?

Rebased 03a2b7426446693505af66280fd6868c210bd035 -> bb36f6e60b961d50b753c35e36c1833f862f8b0c ([pr264.01](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr264.01) -> [pr264.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr264.02)) due to the conflict with #260.

tACK bb36f6e60b961d50b753c35e36c1833f862f8b0c

Tested on macOS 11.2.3 Qt 5.15.2. The menu action works as it should.
![Screen Shot 2021-04-15 at 10 53 14 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/114964836-81095c00-9e3d-11eb-86f0-9075e3969678.png)

#263, which this is based on, is on my plate to review for tomorrow. 🥃
If you copy a row with the keyboard shortcut and paste it you will get rubbish.

@promag
> If you copy a row with the keyboard shortcut and paste it you will get rubbish.

It appears, the problem is much bigger, at least on Linux -- see #283.

Although keyboard shortcuts are out of this PR scope, do you think it'd better to postpone this PR until #283 is fixed?

> > Needs rebase.
> 
> why?

Right, it doesn't actually need, just github showing more commits.
Ok, I removed commits from showing up

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
🐙 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>
